docs.title: API Documentation
docs.subtitle: Complete guide to integrate with your applications

overview.title: API Overview
overview.description: Our REST API enables full integration with your applications. All endpoints return data in JSON format.
overview.baseUrlDescription: All API requests should be directed to:
overview.versioningDescription: The API is versioned through the URL. Current version is v1.
overview.responseFormatDescription: All responses are wrapped in an object with a data key:

auth.title: Authentication
auth.description: The API uses Bearer tokens for authentication. The token must be included in every request in the Authorization header.
auth.getTokenDescription: To get an API token, log in to the dashboard and go to profile settings. There you can generate a new token.
auth.usingTokenDescription: Include the token in every request:
auth.tokenSecurityDescription: Treat your API token like a password. Never share it publicly or store it in source code.

tokenSecurityTips.tip4: Use different tokens for different environments

quickStart.title: Quick Start
quickStart.description: Make your first API request in a few simple steps.
quickStart.step1Description: Log in to the dashboard and generate an API token in profile settings.
quickStart.step2Description: Use the example below to get a list of your databases:
quickStart.step3Description: Now you can explore other endpoints. Start by getting tables from a selected database.
quickStart.congratulationsDescription: You made your first API request. Now you can integrate our API with your applications.

bases.title: Databases
bases.description: Databases are the main containers for your data. Each database can contain multiple tables.
bases.objectDescription: The database object contains the following fields:

endpoints.listDescription: Gets a list of all user's databases.
endpoints.getDescription: Gets details of a specific database.
endpoints.deleteDescription: Deletes a database along with all tables and data.

tables.title: Tables
tables.description: Tables store your data in a row and column (fields) structure.
tables.objectDescription: The table object contains the following fields:

endpoints.listDescription: Gets a list of all tables in a database.
endpoints.createDescription: Creates a new table in a database.
endpoints.deleteDescription: Deletes a table along with all data.

fields.title: Fields
fields.description: Fields define the table structure - columns and their data types.
fields.objectDescription: The field object contains the following attributes:

attributes.name: Field name (column header)
attributes.isPrimary: Whether field is primary (cannot be deleted)

types.title: Field Types
types.description: Available field types and their usage:
types.text: Text - single-line text up to 65535 characters
types.datetime: Date & Time - full date with time
types.select: Select - single choice from option list
types.json: JSON - any data in JSON format

endpoints.listDescription: Gets a list of all fields in a table.
endpoints.getDescription: Gets details of a specific field.
endpoints.createDescription: Adds a new field (column) to the table.
endpoints.updateDescription: Updates field name, type, or options.
endpoints.deleteDescription: Deletes a field and all its values.

rows.title: Records
rows.description: Records (rows) are individual entries in a table, containing values for all fields.

endpoints.listDescription: Gets a paginated list of records from a table.
endpoints.getDescription: Gets a single record with all values.
endpoints.createDescription: Creates a new record with provided values.
endpoints.updateDescription: Updates cell values in a record.
endpoints.deleteDescription: Deletes a record along with all values.

cells.title: Cells
cells.description: Cells are individual values at the intersection of a row and column.
cells.objectDescription: The cell object contains value and metadata:

attributes.value: Cell value (format depends on field type)

valueFormats.title: Value Formats
valueFormats.description: Value format depends on field type:
valueFormats.multiSelect: Array - list of objects with id, name, color

endpoints.updateDescription: Updates the value of a single cell.

attachments.title: Attachments
attachments.description: Attachments allow storing files associated with records.

endpoints.uploadDescription: Uploads a new file as an attachment to a cell.

filtering.title: Filtering
filtering.description: The API supports advanced record filtering by field values.
filtering.syntaxDescription: Filters are passed as a JSON parameter in query string or request body:
filtering.conjunctionDescription: Conditions can be combined with AND or OR operator:
filtering.conjunctionAnd: and - record must match all conditions
filtering.conjunctionOr: or - record must match at least one condition

sorting.title: Sorting
sorting.description: Records can be sorted by values of selected fields.
sorting.syntaxDescription: Sorting is passed as a JSON parameter:
sorting.multiSortDescription: You can sort by multiple fields - array order determines priority:
sorting.nullHandlingDescription: Empty values are always at the end when sorting ascending and at the beginning when descending.

paginationSection.title: Pagination
paginationSection.description: Record lists are automatically paginated for better performance.

errorsSection.title: Error Handling
errorsSection.description: The API returns errors in a consistent JSON format.
errorsSection.formatDescription: Each error contains HTTP code and description:

codes.title: Error Codes
codes.400: 400 Bad Request - Invalid request or data
codes.429: 429 Too Many Requests - Rate limit exceeded

validation.title: Validation Errors
validation.description: Validation errors (422) contain details for each field:
